attributes.action: support proposals made in the Consultation on changes in the charging regime at the Dartford-Thurrock River Crossing that there will continue to be no charge for motorcycles. Further we ask the Prime Minster to ensure that a motorcycle passing lane is installed at the Crossing to free motorcyclists from current safety issues requiring them to stop at the toll barriers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Use of a motorcycle reduces pollution and congestion. The current no charge regime for motorcycles at the Dartford-Thurrock River Crossing recognises this fact. In 05/06 more than 300,000 motorcycles used the crossing. Installing a passing lane at the Crossing will free motorcyclists from the hassle of stopping at the barriers and greatly improve safety. There have been a number of incidents when motorcyclists have collided with toll barriers due to a lack of coordination between the biker and the toll operator.
